attributes.action: Have no legal definition of or reference to 'marriage'; allow any couple a civil partnership
attributes.additional_details:
There are petitions existing for and against changing the legal definition of marriage; however, this petition differs in that it calls for there to be no legal definition of marriage at all.

This petition would see the government remove all references to 'marriage' from all legal statutes. Any two people (without reference to their gender[s]) should be allowed to form a 'civil partnership'.

Civil partnerships should be formed only upon signing a civil partnership document in the presence of a registrar and two witnesses. Any religious ceremony should not constitute the formation of a 'civil partnership'.

There should be no legal definition of 'marriage', but only of 'civil partnerships'. Such changes will end confusion between groups with varying definitions of 'marriage' and promote equality for all couples.
